abstracts.cdata!:
Project ratings are as follows: Project
            outcome is satisfactory, sustainability is likely,
            institutional development impact is modest, Bank performance
            is satisfactory, and borrower performance is satisfactory.
            Among the lessons learned: 1) The successful execution of
            the civil works component by the provinces shows the
            potential benefits of greater decentralization and
            inter-sectoral coordination. 2) Continuity and quality of
            services, which were key elements to attract the population,
            did not receive sufficient attention in the project.
            Similarly, issues related to the health ministry
            reorganization, decentralization or human resources, which
            were critical to the project success, were relegated to the
            Health Financing Project (PFGSS) where their relative
            importance were lessened. 3) The lack of attention to the
            soft aspects (due in part to the project's fragmented
            implementation structure) impacted the project. The project
            could have been restructured since there was little movement
            on these fronts. 4) Greater attention should have been given
            to the links and relationships existing between the project
            and the PFGSS, so as to ensure that all activities of both
            projects were consistent and mutually supportive, and
            promoted a global approach to health care. 5) An assessment
            of existing use rates of health services should have been
            done prior to project implementation, or at the early stages
            of implementation. This would have led to improvement of
            quality and continuity of services, outreach strategies,
            information and education campaigns, electrical and water
            connectivity, transportation means, etc. 6) A good
            monitoring and evaluation system would have been useful for
            assessing project impact. 7) The initial expectation that
            the three Social Priorities Programs could be implemented in
            a synergistic manner by three different ministries proved
            unrealistic. A more robust institutional capability
            assessment may have informed the Bank in calling for
            revisions in the design and the implementation framework.
